snippet: Apathy, anger and frustration at the negative tone of the campaigns resulted in the lowest percentage of voter participation since 1942.
abstract: Editorial contends that abysmally low turnout in midterm elections may have been bad for Democrats but was even worse for democracy; maintains that one useful lesson from the elections is that when voting is made easier, more people vote; urges politicians to make process of voting as easy as possible and to run campaigns that stand for something.
lead_paragraph: Apathy, anger and frustration at the negative tone of the campaigns resulted in the lowest percentage of voter participation since 1942.

headline.main: The Worst Voter Turnout in 72 Years
